00105 int main(int argc, char*argv[]) {
00106 
00107     // Register signal and signal handler
00108    signal(SIGINT, signal_callback_handler);
00109

00111     cout << "\nFile Cyphering:\n casualkrypt -[mode] -[options] -o [OUTfile] -i [INfile] -p [Password]\n\n";
00112     cout << "On-The-Go Cyphering:\n casualkrypt -[mode] -[options] -o [OUTfile] -p [Password] -msg\n";
00113     cout << "\n\nTry 'casualkrypt --help' for more options\n";
00114     }
00115     else {
00116         int errorcode = 0;
00117         errorcode = argumentparser(argc, argv);
00118         displayError(errorcode);
00119     }

00124     //decrypt("PwnSosa",(char*)"OutFile1.pms",(char*)"TheBigDeal.ckt");

00137 //PARSING CHECKER
00138 bool checkParse(char* argv[],int argc,int i){
00139     const char* OPTIONS[] = { "-e","-encrypt","-d","-decrypt","-msg","-b64","-l","-r","-i","-o","-p","--help","--about"};
00140     const int OPT_LENGTH = sizeof(OPTIONS)/sizeof(*OPTIONS);
00141 
00142     if (!(argc > (i+1))){
00143         return false;
00144     }
00145     else { 
00146         char* parse = argv[i+1];
00147         
00148         for (int i = 0; i < OPT_LENGTH; i++){
00149             if (strcmp(parse,OPTIONS[i])== 0){
00150                 return false;
00151             }
00152         }
00153     }
00154     return true;
00155 }

00157 //MAKE A COPY OF ANY FILE
00158 char* fileCopy(char* file){
00159     
00160         //Declare both Files. Copy & Original
00161         fstream fileCopy;
00162         string copyText;
00163         
00164         //Open and copy whats in Original to string
00165         ifstream TextBuffer(file, ios::binary);
00166         TextBuffer.seekg(0, ios::end);
00167         copyText.reserve(TextBuffer.tellg());
00168         TextBuffer.seekg(0, ios::beg);
00169         copyText.assign((istreambuf_iterator<char>(TextBuffer)),istreambuf_iterator<char>());
00170         
00171         //Copy string to copyFile
00172         fileCopy.open("OrigCopy.ckt",fstream::out | ios::binary);
00173         fileCopy << copyText;
00174         fileCopy.close();
00175     
00176     return (char*)"OrigCopy.ckt";
00177 }

00179 //ARGUMENT PARSER
00180 int argumentparser(int argc, char*argv[]) {
00181     char* inFile = (char*)"";
00182     char* outFile = (char*)"cypher.txt";
00183     char* transFile = (char*)"";
00184     char* inFileOriginal = inFile;
00185     bool RemoveOrigin = false;
00186     bool onTheGo = false;
00187     bool runSilent= false;
00188     bool openOutput = false;
00189     int fileSize = 0;
00190    
00191     
00192     int repeat = 0;
00193 
00194     string password = "";

00196     bool modeGiven = false;
00197     bool inFileGiven = false;
00198     bool outFileGiven = true;
00199     bool passGiven = false;
00200     bool b64 = false;
00201     bool print = false;
00202     bool loud = false;
00203     bool pDisplacement = false;
00204     bool header = false;
00205     bool vectorAlgorithm =false;
00206     
00207     
00208    /* THIS IS THE PUBLISHED VERSION
00209     * THEREFORE IT IS ONLY NATURAL THAT THE ENCRYPTION PROTOCOL SHOULD BE THE BEST POSSIBLE
00210     * SO BY DEFAULT IT WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING VALUES:
00211     */
00212     modeGiven = true;
00213     b64 = true;
00214     repeat = 2;
00215     pDisplacement = true;
00216     header = true;
00217     vectorAlgorithm =true;
00219 
00220     for(int i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
00221 
00222         if (strcmp(argv[i],"--help")==0){
00223             return 5;
00224         }
00225 
00226         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"--about")==0){
00227             return 6;
00228         }
00229 
00230         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"--easter")==0){
00231             return 7;
00232         }
00233 
00234         //CHECK MODE
00235         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"-e")==0) {
00236             mode = ENC;
00237             modeGiven = true;
00238         }
00239         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"-encrypt")==0) {
00240             mode = ENC;
00241             modeGiven= true;
00242         }
00243         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"-d")==0) {
00244             mode = DEC;
00245             modeGiven=true;
00246         }
00247         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"-decrypt")==0) {
00248             mode = DEC;
00249             modeGiven = true;
00250         }
00251         //CHECK OPTIONS
00252         //-Repeat
00253         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"-r")==0) {
00254             if (checkParse(argv,argc,i)){
00255                 i++;
00256                 repeat = atoi(argv[i]);
00257                 if (repeat == 0){
00258                     return 9;
00259                 }
00260                 if (repeat == 1){
00261                     repeat = 0; //Because 1 causes a bug.
00262                 }
00263             } else { return 9;}
00264         }
00265         //-Loud
00266         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"-l")==0) {
00267             loud = true;
00268         }
00269         //-Delete Original
00270         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"-del")==0) {
00271             RemoveOrigin = true;
00272         }
00273         //-Run Background
00274         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"-s")==0) {
00275             runSilent= true;
00276         }
00277         //-Run Background
00278         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"-open")==0) {
00279             openOutput= true;
00280         }
00281         //-Base64 Encoding
00282         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"-b64")==0) {
00283             if (checkParse(argv,argc,i)){
00284                 i++;
00285                 b64 = (bool) atoi(argv[i]);
00286             }
00287         }
00288         //-Vector Algorithm
00289         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"-v")==0) {
00290             if (checkParse(argv,argc,i)){
00291                 i++;
00292                 vectorAlgorithm = (bool) atoi(argv[i]);
00293             }
00294         }
00295         //-Strong
00296         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"-strong")==0) {
00297             b64 = true;
00298             repeat = 2;
00299             pDisplacement = true;
00300             header = true;
00301         }
00302         //-Password Displacement
00303         else if (strcmp(argv[i], "-pdis")==0) {
00304             if (checkParse(argv,argc,i)){
00305                 i++;
00306                 pDisplacement = (bool) atoi(argv[i]);
00307             }
00308         }
00309         //-Header
00310         else if (strcmp(argv[i], "-h")==0) {
00311             if (checkParse(argv,argc,i)){
00312                 i++;
00313                 header = (bool) atoi(argv[i]);
00314             }
00315         }
00316 
00317 
00318         //CHECK FILES
00319         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"-i")==0) {
00320             if (onTheGo == false){
00321                 if (checkParse(argv,argc,i)){
00322                     i++;
00323                     inFile = argv[i];
00324                     ifstream testFile(inFile);
00325                     if (!testFile.fail()){
00326                         inFileGiven = true;
00327                         testFile.seekg (0, ios::end);
00328                         fileSize = testFile.tellg();
00329                         testFile.close();
00330                     }
00331                 }
00332             }
00333             else {return 8;}
00334         }
00335         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"-o")==0) {
00336             if (checkParse(argv,argc,i)){
00337                 i++;
00338                 outFile = argv[i];
00339 
00340                 ifstream testFile(outFile);
00341                 if (testFile){
00342                     outFileGiven = true;
00343                 }
00344             }
00345         }
00346 
00347         //CHECK IF IT IS ON-THE-GO//
00348         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"-msg")==0) {
00349             if (inFileGiven == false){
00350                 onTheGo = true;
00351             }
00352             else{ return 8;}
00353         }
00354 
00355         //CHECK PASSWORD
00356         else if (strcmp(argv[i],"-p")==0) {
00357             if (argc > (i+1)){
00358                 if (!checkParse(argv,argc,i)){
00359                     cout << "\nWARNING: Password \""<<argv[i+1] <<"\" is also considered an option.\n"
00360                          << "Did you forget to write out the password?\n"
00361                          << "If you didn't, then disregard this message\n"
00362                          << "Cyphering will we done with the given password.\n\n";
00363                 }
00364                 i++;
00365                 password = argv[i];
00366                 passGiven = true;
00367             }
00368         }
00369         
00370         else {cout <<"\nParameter: " <<  argv[i] << " not recognized.\n"; return 10;}
00371     }
00372     
00373     //ON THE GO ENCRYPTION/DECRYPTION
00374     if (onTheGo == true){
00375             string clearText = " ";
00376             cout << "\nWrite your message: \n\n";
00377             getline( cin, clearText );
00378             //Create the TempFile
00379             inFile = (char*) "TempCKTFile.ckt";
00380             inFileGiven = true;
00381             //Fill the File with the cleartext
00382             fstream clearFile;
00383             clearFile.open(inFile,fstream::out);
00384             clearFile << clearText;
00385             clearFile.close();
00386             //Makesure it is Erased Eventually.
00387             RemoveOrigin = true;
00388         }
00389 
00390     //Print Variable - Do we want to print the enc/dec process?
00391     //if (loud == true || onTheGo == true){ print = true;}
00392     print = loud;
00393         
00394     //If everything is parsed and correct then lets enc/dec!  
00395     if (modeGiven && inFileGiven && outFileGiven && passGiven) {
00396         
00397         //IF GO SILENT, THEN DISAPPEAR
00398         if (runSilent){
00399             stealth();
00400         }
00401         
00402         
00403         //ENCRYPTION MODE
00404         if (mode == ENC) {
00405             
00406             //Copy Original File - Precaution in case somthing goes wrong. We don't want to damage the original.
00407             inFileOriginal = inFile;
00408             inFile = fileCopy(inFile);
00409             
00410             Encryptor message;
00411             
00412             for (int i = 0; i<=repeat; i++) {
00413 
00414                 //REPEAT, SWITCHING FILES
00415                 if (i != 0){
00416                     transFile = outFile;
00417                     outFile = inFile;
00418                     inFile = transFile;
00419                 }
00420                 
00421                 message.encrypt(password, inFile, outFile, true, b64, pDisplacement,vectorAlgorithm, print,header);
00422             }
00423             
00424         }
00425         else if (mode == DEC) {
00426             
00427             //Copy Original File - Precaution in case somthing goes wrong. We don't want to damage the original.
00428             inFileOriginal = inFile;
00429             inFile = fileCopy(inFile);
00430             
00431             Decryptor message;
00432             
00433             for (int i = 0; i<=repeat; i++) {
00434             
00435                 if (i != 0){
00436                     transFile = outFile;
00437                     outFile = inFile;
00438                     inFile = transFile;
00439                 }
00440                 
00441                 message.decrypt(password, inFile, outFile, true, b64, pDisplacement,vectorAlgorithm, print,header);
00442             }
00443         }
00444         
00445         if (openOutput){
00446             /*Seems overly complicated just to open a simple file with the Commandline
00447               But it turns out that the difference between cmd "text.txt" and cmd "start text.txt"
00448               Is that without the "start" the program will wait for the file to finish executing before continuing.
00449               With the "start" the program will simply start another detached process. -12:22AM 5/19/2012 (ima gonna go to sleep now)
00450             */
00451             stringstream tempStream;
00452             string cmd;
00453             tempStream << "start " << outFile << endl;
00454             getline(tempStream,cmd);
00455             system(cmd.c_str());
00456         }
00457         
00458         if (RemoveOrigin){
00459             if (remove(inFileOriginal) != 0){cout << "Couldn't delete original file"<<endl;}
00460         }
00461         
00462     } 
00463     else if (modeGiven !=true){ return 3;}
00464     else if (inFileGiven !=true){return 2;}
00465     else if (passGiven !=true) {return 4;}
00466     else {return 1;}
00467 
00468     //Loud Printing of Variables for Debuggin Purpose
00469     if (loud) {
00470         cout << "<>-----------<>\n"
00471              << "  Mode: " <<mode << endl
00472              << "  In File: " << inFileOriginal << endl
00473              << "  FileSize: " << setw(1) << setprecision(2) << fixed << fileSize << " Bytes" << endl
00474              << "  Out File: " << outFile << endl
00475              << "  Password: " << password << endl
00476              << "  Repeats: " << repeat << endl
00477              << "  Base64: " << (bool) b64 <<endl
00478              << "  Password Displacement: " <<(bool) pDisplacement<< endl
00479              << "  Vector Algorithm: " << (bool) vectorAlgorithm << endl
00480              << "  Delete Original: " << (bool)RemoveOrigin << endl
00481              << "  Open Output File: " << (bool)openOutput << endl
00482              << "  Loud : " << loud << "\n\n";
00483 
00484     }
00485 
00486     return 0;
00487 }

00523 //PRINTING META INFORMATION
00524 int printMetaInfo(int info){
00525     if (info == 1){
00526         cout<<"\nFile Cyphering:\n casualkrypt -[mode] -[options] -o [OUTfile] -i [INfile] -p [Password]\n\n"
00527             <<"On-The-Go Cyphering:\n casualkrypt -[mode] -[options] -o [OUTfile] -p [Password] -msg"
00528             <<"\n\n"
00529             <<"MODES:\n"
00530             <<" -e , -encrypt : Encrypt File\n"
00531             <<" -d , -decrypt : Decrypt File"
00532             <<"\n\n"
00533             <<"OPTIONS:\n"
00534             <<" -msg   : Let's you type in your own message on the console.\n"
00535             <<" -r [x] : (Default: 2) Repeat Enc/Dec [x] amount of times.\n"
00536             <<" -l     : Prints Data To Screen\n"
00537             <<" -del   : Deletes input file upon cyphering completion\n"
00538             <<" -h     : (0-ON, 1-OFF,Default= ON) Adds Encryption Header for added security\n"
00539             <<" -pdis  : (0-ON, 1-OFF,Default= ON) Password Displacement for added security\n"
00540             <<" -b64   : (0-ON, 1-OFF,Default= ON) Use Base64 Encoding\n"
00541             <<" -v     : (0-ON, 1-OFF,Default= ON) Use Anarchy Vector Algorithm\n"
00542             <<" -s     : Run Silent. Run on Background\n"
00543             <<" -open  : Open the output file when done.\n"
00544             <<"\n\n"
00545             <<"FILES:\n"
00546             <<" -i [INfile]    : input file to encrypt or decrypt.\n"
00547             <<" -o [OUTfile]   : output (enc/dec) processed file.\n"
00548             <<"                 (OPTIONAL - Default: cyphered.txt)\n"
00549             <<" -p [Password]  : The password.\n\n"
00550             <<" (If files/passwords have spaces : write between qoutation marks \"test 1\")\n"
00551             <<" (You can reference files on different directories \"C:\\programs\\foo.txt\")"
00552             <<"\n\n"
00553             <<" --about : information about the program\n"
00554             <<" --help  : displays this usage screen"
00555             <<"\n\n\n";
00556     }
00557 
00558     else if (info == 2){
00559         cout << "\nCasualKrypt 1.5.0\n"
00560              << "Programmed by: Pedro M. Sosa <konukoii@gmail.com>\n"
00561              << "Website & Donations: sosavpm.users.sourceforge.net\n\n"
00562              << "Licenced under GNU GPL\n"
00563              << "(C) 2012 Pedro Sosa\n"
00564              << "This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.\n"
00565              << "There is NO warranty; not even for MERCHTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE\n"
00566              << "Base64 Encoding programmed by Rene Nyffenegger\n\n";
00567     }
00568     else if (info ==3){easter();}
00569     return 0;
00570 }
00571 
00572 //ERROR DISPLAY
00573 int displayError(int& errorCode){
00574 
00575     if (errorCode == 0){cout << "\nGreat Success!\n";}
00576     if (errorCode == 1){cout << "\nError: Not enough arguments given!\n";}
00577     if (errorCode == 2){cout << "\nError: File to Enc/Dec does not exist\n";}
00578     if (errorCode == 3){cout << "\nError: No Mode Given!\n";}
00579     if (errorCode == 4){cout << "\nError: No Password Given!\n";}
00580     if (errorCode == 5){printMetaInfo(1); return 0;} //help
00581     if (errorCode == 6){printMetaInfo(2);} //about
00582     if (errorCode == 7){printMetaInfo(3);} //easter Egg
00583     if (errorCode == 8){cout << "\nInput file given and On-The-Go text recieved! Can't do both at the same time.\n";}
00584     if (errorCode == 9){cout << "\n'-r' option given with no valid number given\n";}
00585     if (errorCode != 0){cout << "\nTry 'casualkrypt --help' for usage information\n";}
00586     return 0;
00587 }
00588 
00589 //SIGNAL CALLBACK HANDLER
00590 void signal_callback_handler(int signum){
00591     cout << "Caught Terminate Signal " << signum;
00592     
00593     /* CLEANUP AND CLOSE STUFF HERE
00594        This is actually written in for the eventual Qt GUI that will be developed
00595        The whole point of it is that if by any chance this program dies it returns -1
00596        That way the Qt GUI will get the message and warn the user that the process is dead.
00597     */
00598     try {
00599     
00600         /*In Theory you could check here wether any file is currently in use
00601         and then try to close it for good. But, in practice C++ takes care of 
00602         closing everything up without leaving any curropt files behind.*/
00603         
00604         //message.empty();
00605         cout << "\nGoodbye! (Code 1)\n";
00606         exit(-1);
00607     }
00608     catch (int e){
00609         //If you fail closing any files, simply quit and don't worry, be happy.
00610         cout << "\nGoodbye! (Code 2)\n";
00611         exit(-1);
00612     }
00613     
00614     // Terminate program
00615     exit(signum);
00616 }

00618 //RUN ON BACKGROUND
00619 void stealth(){
00620     HWND stealth;
00621     AllocConsole();
00622     stealth = FindWindowA("ConsoleWindowClass", NULL);
00623     ShowWindow(stealth,0);
00624     
00625     SetPriorityClass(GetCurrentProcess(),BELOW_NORMAL_PRIORITY_CLASS);
00626     
00627 }
